body:
retest this please
  Quota issues for dataflow WordCount ITs

Alright, there's a mismatch here.

The Pipeline will be marked as "in a terminal state" before it finishes tearing down all of the resources associated with it (`shutdownIfNecessary` - the update to the `pipelineState` precedes all cleanup work). As such, `waitUntilFinish` returns before calls to `teardown` or other cleanups complete.

I'm not particularly concerned about that sequencing in either direction for resource management, given that we will always clean up the resources we have used if the process continues, or the process will be killed and we no longer care, combined with the fact that we make in general no guarantees about calling teardown on all instances of a DoFn.

If you want to ensure that `teardown` is called on all `DoFn` instances when a pipeline completes before it returns as `finished`, moving the `pipelineState.compareAndSet(State.RUNNING, newState);` line in `ExecutorServiceParallelExecutor` to happen last is where that change belongs (as it will catche all cleanup work, rather than a special case for DoFns). I'm ambivalent about the change (given that certainly some production systems will discard 'live' `DoFns` by terminating the process on which they exist, and it isn't safe to do work in `teardown` that is required for correct behavior).

Might be worth filing a JIRA for the JDBC issue in case it's a bug in the sink.

I'm fine with enabling this tests for a smaller Dataset and increasing the size later after fixes.

*[sdks/java/nexmark/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/nexmark/queries/sql/SqlQuery1.java, line 58 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4129#-L2S1kXNLBJw_h9kCA_H:-L2S1kXNLBJw_h9kCA_I:b-p01uyt) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/28921a37588d27aa41a853bfda7d963b2da8d010/sdks/java/nexmark/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/nexmark/queries/sql/SqlQuery1.java#L58)):*
> ```Java
>     @Override
>     public Long apply(Long price) {
>       return (price * 89) / 100;
> ```

Should be x84 now :-). But also this doesn't look like it has the arbitrary slowdown suggested.

> ```Java
>     PCollection<BeamRecord> bidEventsRecords = allEvents
>         .apply(Filter.by(IS_BID))
>         .apply(ToBeamRecord.parDo())
> ```

Let's go ahead and merge this PR as-is and move to automated things when ready.

Let's use a trigger configuration that yields correct results, like default trigger on FixedWindows, and port the example back to Java with the same so they can be compared.
Updated the window spec. Not sure why it is this way in the java query3. Looking at the [original commit](https://github.com/apache/beam/commit/7c28b492aa17160d9a84914814e618716b7beb9f#diff-d5894fed6c92d9719184cf52b37bc0d2L195) for java query3, it was explicitly changed to `GlobalWindows` to comply with State/Timer APIs. Not sure what it means. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4352)*
As an additional note, this has made me realize that the `compareTo` method of `TimerData` doesn't consider IDs, which makes any of the `NavigableSet` usage broken.
Looks like the same breakage from hcatalog on all my PRs. Known?
It also looks like findbugs under gradle puts output not in the Jenkins log but a file and logs a local filesystem URL.
hcatalog was one of the hardest modules I attempted to shade because of how many dependencies bundled without relocating things.
Moved the EncodedBoundedWindow to sdks/java/fn-execution which seemed like a more appropriate place then runners/core-java.

Previously, kennknowles (Kenn Knowles) wrote…
Try some longer comments here to describe the state, like "A `ValueState` stores a single value per key and window. Because our state is globally windowed, it is just key partitioned, with one score per team. To store the value, the state must be encoded, so we provide a coder, in this case the `VarIntCoder`. You can also let Beam's coder inference try to provide a coder automatically by leaving it off, as it `StateSpecs.value()`." etc Also cover the `StateId` annotation gives it an identifier, which we use to reference it in `@ProcessElement`
Done. --- *[examples/java8/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/examples/complete/game/AggregatedTeamScore.java, line 173 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4272#-L2N2KvYgu07GfgJjotq:-L2SZKCMC3Q8K2dQA9iK:b-896fix) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/d5eefb4a0d25fd520b9d799c3a54fbed6cbcb229/examples/java8/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/examples/complete/game/AggregatedTeamScore.java#L173)):*

Good point. Looks like the additional shading throughout broke the example ITs.
But suspiciously did not break the same way in gradle.

So far, I have not been able to reproduce a failure. Wondering if it has to do with either the one-command build or the all-the-runners profile, since those would also be different for the gradle build.

Im not 100% sure I fully see the change you suggest - will check tomorrow cause Im not sure I can today - but there are 3 points on the change - as a behavior:

1. Make it aligned on other runners
2. Make it usable in tests and with a controlled behavior (scoped to the test method)
3. You cant assume anything of the teardown behavior, can report some data or whatever so we must call it in any case if the user asked for it I think
  

edit: @tgroh updated the PR accordingly to your tip (thanks!), just kept the SDF enhancements to ensure it is valid for it as well. Can be reworked in another PR to use the cache it doesn't ATM

@jkff & @kennknowles The main blocker right now seems to be this: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/dbb850c3c3dedc7f62d90cdf7f15fe7cff79ce1b/runners/core-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/core/StatefulDoFnRunner.java#L106

When the input watermark goes to `BoundedWindow.TIMESTAMP_MAX_VALUE` this is always going to be `true`, because the GC time is clipped to `BoundedWindow.TIMESTAMP_MAX_VALUE` in `LateDataUtils.garbageCollectionTime()`. I think the solution is to not use any late-dropping `DoFnRunner` when executing a `ProcessFn` because it doesn't play by the normal `DoFn` rules anyways (custom state management, access to timer internals, etc.). What do you think?

@chamikaramj  For this PR to properly run, following tables must be created in BigQuery:
```
beam_performance.textioit_pkb_results
beam_performance.compressed_textioit_pkb_results
beam_performance.avroioit_pkb_results
beam_performance.tfrecordioit_pkb_results
```
or [this PR on PerfKit](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/PerfKitBenchmarker/pull/1554) that allows automatic creation must be merged.

>Any idea why following failed ?
> https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PerformanceTests_HadoopInputFormatIO_IT/1/console

@chamikaramj Judging from the logs you attached either the kubeconfig's location is wrong or the postgres.yml's. In the new commit i tried to overwrite the kubeconfig's location it with value I got from our local jenkins setup hoping that it's some default value. No luck. 

I think someone with access to jenkins is needed - we need to know the path to kubeconfig to set it up correctly.

I did a diff before and after this change:

```
87,88c87,88
< [INFO] +- com.google.cloud.bigtable:bigtable-protos:jar:1.0.0-pre3:compile
< [INFO] +- com.google.cloud.bigtable:bigtable-client-core:jar:1.0.0-pre3:compile
---
> [INFO] +- com.google.cloud.bigtable:bigtable-protos:jar:1.0.0:compile
> [INFO] +- com.google.cloud.bigtable:bigtable-client-core:jar:1.0.0:compile
90a91,92
> [INFO] |  +- io.opencensus:opencensus-contrib-grpc-util:jar:0.7.0:compile
> [INFO] |  |  \- io.opencensus:opencensus-api:jar:0.7.0:compile
```

*Note*: this doesn't change the version of grpc.  The version of grpc used by Beam remains at 1.2.0, where as Cloud Bigtable is on 1.8.0.

After the issue with the reproducible builds plugin version I decided to update most of the plugins on the maven build, I know that we are moving to gradle but in the meantime is better not to let rot the maven  infrastructure since we depend on it. I put the updates separetly so we can revert in case of any issue but feel free to squash if you prefer.
Extra note: I didn't update the javadoc plugin because the latest version has an issue that breaks the build.

Solomon, this change causes BigTable connector post-submit tests to fail. Looks like we need to update dependencies (which results in other issues) or to shard dependencies away. See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3387

I filed https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3412 for this.
Confirmed by looking at other PRs that the failure in Dataflow WordCountIT is present on `master` (!!)
Diagnosed the issue - it is a Dataflow limitation that we are hitting across the board. Gonna merge this fix.

_Most_ tests pass with this change. However, `MetricsTest.testBoundedSourceMetrics` fails due to a Flink execution error. Flink complains that the execution graph is invalid since there are no streaming operators defined. If there's a deeper problem with the translation migration, I'm not sure why it only affects this one metrics test.
@sduskis  I have update PR to address your comments, please take a look, thank you.
Most of this has been subsumed by https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/4367, please update PR.
Robert, if your work with state sampling / metrics subsumes this PR, please close this.

I decided to respect the semantics that it has before and add these semantics to the other Unbounded IOs on Beam in a future PR. I added an extra validation to see if a stream exists before continuing with the execution. PTAL @jkff
This is subsumed by a change to the Dataflow worker that @charlesccychen is working on.
Rebased on #4367, it's just a minor cleanup now. PTAL.
Ah, I didn't see this. Sorry for the duplication!
(I mean I didn't see it just now - obviously I saw it when I first commented :-)

You changed all the names of the `to` methods. Were you planning on changing the `from` method names as well? Doesn't have to be this PR, just wondering why you wanted to rename all the methods.
Yea, the readability of them all having the same name was getting pretty bad. I don't have a great idea of what to rename the other ones but I would definitely like to do so. --- *[runners/core-construction-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/core/construction/ParDoTranslation.java, line 150 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4356#-L2MWFI_eAcqwtP4bUiY:-L2XITM7R64uycAS30uQ:bgefpqq) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/5a38bdee4d640967ccbcfaa82516e448d3b1ef66/runners/core-construction-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/core/construction/ParDoTranslation.java#L150)):*

This will not spam. It is once per job launch. Done. --- *[runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/PrimitiveParDoSingleFactory.java, line 113 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4356#-L2Mii3LDuSxAByA4WLa:-L2XKyLhQ9t6uJKbEHMO:b-363dwj) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/5a38bdee4d640967ccbcfaa82516e448d3b1ef66/runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/PrimitiveParDoSingleFactory.java#L113)):*
Previously, lukecwik (Lukasz Cwik) wrote…
Can we not use `ParDoSingleViaMulti` and use the existing translation inside ParDoTranslation?
Because of Dataflow's limitation and UI goals, we override SingleViaMulti to be a Dataflow-specific Single. That way it can have display data (composites cannot have display data) and also shows up non-nested in the UI. --- *[runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/DataflowPipelineTranslatorTest.java, line 166 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4356#-L2MgsWdYzTYzvaBdFqM:-L2XLNMh82vw0qiZN4FM:b-crnxyy) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/5a38bdee4d640967ccbcfaa82516e448d3b1ef66/runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/DataflowPipelineTranslatorTest.java#L166)):*
Previously, lukecwik (Lukasz Cwik) wrote…
This file did not change in any meaningful way other then whitespace. If you want to fix formatting, a separate PR would have made more sense.
Reverted. It changed (addition of a parameter) and then changed back (removal of a parameter) so I had autoformatted it. --- *[sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/ParDo.java, line 584 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4356#-L2MgHGZDCUFH7KUW09j:-L2XLx2e-KZPUX9UrHiT:by3w2c6) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/5a38bdee4d640967ccbcfaa82516e448d3b1ef66/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/ParDo.java#L584)):*
Previously, lukecwik (Lukasz Cwik) wrote…
I don't think we want to make this public. Seems pretty easy to just copy the constant or place it in pipeline translation instead of polluting a users auto complete.

I suspect you are going to have to explicitly remove each dependency, as I doubt this config is transitive. This is fixed already in the gradle build, but as long as we stick with maven, I would suggest this course of action:

 - Delete the `jenkins-precommit` profile and all of its executions. They confuse Jenkins anyhow.
 - Make a separate groovy file for example ITs (this adds value on its own, since unit tests will be more reliable).
 - In that file, use shell commands so you can do more than one (I think `mavenJob` only supports one lol) so you can do a "no frills" maven install of the examples and all runners, followed by independent calls to run ITs. Whatever the groovy version of this:

```
mvn -DskipTests -Dmdeps.analyze.skip -Drat.skip -Dfindbugs.skip -Djavadoc.skip clean install -P apex-runner,spark-runner,dataflow-runner,direct-runner,flink-runner -pl examples/java -am

# Flink
mvn --errors failsafe:integration-test@flink-runner-integration-tests \
    -pl examples/java \
    -P flink-runner \
    -D beamTestPipelineOptions=... flink options from the jenkins-precommit profile ...

# Spark
mvn --errors failsafe:integration-test@spark-runner-integration-tests \
    -pl examples/java \
    -P spark-runner \
    -D beamTestPipelineOptions=... spark options from the jenkins-precommit profile ...

etc
```

I don't know how to make that parallel, unfortunately. This was/should become a pipeline job eventually that parallelizes the IT runs I guess.

This will have a smidgin of overhead due to recompiling the SDK and runners, but you should be able to skip a lot. Optionally, you could make this migration for _only_ the Dataflow execution from the existing config.

LGTM.

Could you also update the https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/python/container/Dockerfile

We probably need an issue to update all dependencies before the next release. Perhaps we can repurpose the JIRA issue to do that.
I think you said in person that this dependency update turned out to be more complicated than this? Or were you talking about something else? If it's that simple and passes tests, then LGTM.
There is an internal change that @charlesccychen is working on that will make this PR moot.

I said it was more complicated than I thought to replace apache_beam.io.gcp.internal.clients.bigquery with google.cloud.bigquery. It seems that Beam SDK exposes apache_beam.io.gcp.internal.clients.bigquery datatypes.

This PR only updates google.cloud.bigquery's version.
